name: FortifyOnDemandStatic
description: Submit code for Fortify on Demand security assessment
author: Micro Focus

inputs.name: FortifyProjects
inputs.label: Source code location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path on the agent where your source code files are located.

inputs.name: ScanCentralLocation
inputs.label: ScanCentral file location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path on the agent where your scan central files are located.

inputs.name: FodConnection
inputs.label: Fortify Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the endpoint to Fortify

inputs.name: ReleaseOptions
inputs.label: Pick a Release
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick a release to use for scanning

inputs.name: ReleaseId
inputs.label: Release ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The release ID provides a CI token that never changes. The release ID is HIGHLY recommended for CI usage as the BSI token is being sunset in 2021

inputs.name: BSIToken
inputs.label: Build Server Integration Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Generate a BSI Token. For more information, see https://ams.fortify.com/Docs/en/Content/20_Applications/1_Tenant_Apps/06_App_Tabs/09_BuildServer/BSI_Using.htm

inputs.name: ApplicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify or type the name of your application.

inputs.name: BusinessCriticality
inputs.label: Business Criticality
inputs.helpMarkDown: High: Security issues could have catastrophic consequences for the business. Medium: Security issues would have non-trivial consequences, but ones which do not pose a lift-or-death threat to the business. Low: Security issues can be ignored or addressed gradually as time possible.

inputs.name: ApplicationAttributes
inputs.label: Application Attributes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Required application attributes must be specified. Example: Attribute Name1: Attribute Value1; Attribute Name2: Attribute Value2

inputs.name: ApplicationType
inputs.label: Application Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the application type: Web/Thick-Client or Mobile.

inputs.name: MicroserviceName
inputs.label: Microservice Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the check box to scan the application as a microservice appication.Important ! The designation of a microservice application is permanent and cannot be changed after the application has been created.

inputs.name: ReleaseName
inputs.label: Release Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify or type the name of your release.

inputs.name: SDLCStatus
inputs.label: SDLC Status
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the software development life cycle from the list. Retired is not available.

inputs.name: Owner
inputs.label: Owner ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The owner will receive email notifications of scan status updates for the release

inputs.name: Entitlement
inputs.label: Entitlement ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an entitlement to use.

inputs.name: OverrideScanSettings
inputs.label: Choose Scan Settings Source (Always applicable to New App/Release)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a source of scan settings to be used for starting a scan.

options.1: Create/Override Existing Scan Settings if any

inputs.name: AssessmentTypeId
inputs.label: Assessment Type Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: Please find the assessment Type Id from GET /api/v3/releases/{releaseId}/assessment-types.

inputs.name: AuditPreference
inputs.label: Audit Preference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Audit Preference.

inputs.name: InProgressScanActionType
inputs.label: Action if Scan In Progress
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to handle a new scan if a scan is already in progress

inputs.name: RemediationScanPreference
inputs.label: Remediation Preference Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to handle remediation scans

inputs.name: BuildType
inputs.label: Build Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the build tool name used for the project or technology stack if it's PHP or Python to use ScanCentral Client for packaging your source.

inputs.name: TechnologyStackNet
inputs.label: Technology Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Technology Stack

inputs.name: TechnologyStackJavaOne
inputs.label: Technology Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Technology Stack

inputs.name: TechnologyStackJavaTwo
inputs.label: Technology Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Technology Stack

inputs.name: TechnologyStackOthers
inputs.label: Technology Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Technology Stack

inputs.name: LanguageLevelDotNet
inputs.label: Language Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Language Level

inputs.name: LanguageLevelDotNetCore
inputs.label: Language Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Language Level

inputs.name: LanguageLevelJava
inputs.label: Language Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Language Level

inputs.name: OpenSourceComponent
inputs.label: Open Source Component Analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check the box to perform open source scan. Note: Refer to the Debricked documentation for the list of required files to be submitted in the payload for a successful Debricked scan
inputs.visibleRule: TechnologyStackNet = 1 || TechnologyStackNet = 23 || TechnologyStackJavaOne = 7 ||TechnologyStackJavaTwo = 7|| TechnologyStackOthers = 1 || TechnologyStackOthers = 22 || TechnologyStackOthers = 23 || TechnologyStackOthers = 9 ||TechnologyStackOthers = 16 || TechnologyStackOthers = 17 || TechnologyStackOthers = 7 || BuildType = python || BuildType = php || BuildType = go

inputs.name: BuildCommand
inputs.label: Build Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify custom build parameters for preparing and building a project.
inputs.visibleRule: BuildType = mvn || BuildType = gradle || BuildType = msbuild

inputs.name: BuildFile
inputs.label: Build File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the build file if you are not using a default name such as build.gradle or pom.xml.
inputs.visibleRule: BuildType = mvn || BuildType = gradle || BuildType = msbuild

inputs.name: IncludeTests
inputs.label: Include Tests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include test source set (Gradle or test scope  (Maven in the scan  (for Java projects only).

inputs.name: SkipBuild
inputs.label: Skip Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skips the build invocation that prepares generated sources and libraries before collecting the project information.
inputs.visibleRule: BuildType = gradle || BuildType = msbuild || BuildType = mvn

inputs.name: PythonVersion
inputs.label: Python Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the Python version to automatically find the isntalled Python.

inputs.name: PythonVirtualEnvironment
inputs.label: Python Virtual Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Python virtual environment location

inputs.name: PythonRequirementsFile
inputs.label: Python Requirements File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the Python project requirements file to install and collect dependencies.

inputs.name: PolicyFailAction
inputs.label: Action if Failing Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to handle if a security policy fails

instanceNameFormat: Run Fortify on Demand static assessment on $(FortifyProjects)
